adverb.description: As a consequence; for this reason.
examples: a stiff breeze and hence a high windchill

adverb.description: In the future (used after a period of time)
examples: two years hence they might say something quite different

origin: Middle English hennes (in hence (sense 3)): from earlier henne (from Old English heonan, of Germanic origin, related to he)+ -s (later respelled -ce to denote the unvoiced sound).
